bug.author: opencv-pushbot
bug.description:
Transferred from http://code.opencv.org/issues/3785 || Konstantin Kulakov on 2014-07-01 04:46 || Priority: Low || Affected: branch 'master' (3.0-dev) || Category: build/install || Tracker: Bug || Difficulty: Medium || PR: || Platform: x64 / Windows Compilation (installation) error of opencv at WIndows Sourse in github: https://github.com/itseez/opencv CMake: 3.0 GCC: gcc (i686-posix-dwarf-rev2, Built by MinGW-W64 project) 4.9.0 I compiled OpenCV. I got an error: [ 29%] Built target pch_Generate_opencv_core Linking CXX shared library ..\..\bin\libopencv_core300.dll C:/mingw/mingw32/bin/../lib/gcc/i686-w64-mingw32/4.9.0/../../../../i686-w64-ming w32/bin/ld.exe: *cannot find -lRunTmChk* collect2.exe: error: ld returned 1 exit status modules\core\CMakeFiles\opencv_core.dir\build.make:1103: recipe for target 'bin/ libopencv_core300.dll' failed mingw32-make[2]: *** [bin/libopencv_core300.dll] Error 1 CMakeFiles\Makefile2:1313: recipe for target 'modules/core/CMakeFiles/opencv_cor e.dir/all' failed mingw32-make[1]: *** [modules/core/CMakeFiles/opencv_core.dir/all] Error 2 makefile:135: recipe for target 'all' failed mingw32-make: *** [all] Error 2 History Steven Puttemans on 2014-07-31 12:26 Did you have a previous VS system configured? I have read something about VC and Mingw screwing each others installations, and this seems exactly that. Maxime Th√©bault on 2014-08-20 17:13 I'm having the same issue (cmake 2.8.12.2, Mingw 4.9.1 i686-posix-dwarf-rev0). I think I've never had Visual Studio installed on that computer. Florian Simond on 2014-08-24 17:19 I'm having the same problem. I have never had VS installed on my computer neither, moreover I can compile OpenCV 2.4.9 without any problem... lorenzoo lorenzoo on 2014-09-05 08:47 Hi all, exactly the same here Windows7 64 bit and VS installed By the way I can compile opencv 2.4.9 without problem Ryein Goddard on 2014-09-11 21:41 I have the same issue using mingw as well. I found that for some reason IPP was turn on by default when using Cmake 3.0 GUI. I just disabled it and everything compiled fine. I have AMD CPU & GPU so not sure why IPP was turned on. IPP is Intel only right? Florian Simond on 2014-09-12 06:11 Yes the problem seems to come with IPP. Here is some line of OpenCVFindIPP.cmake: 
if(WIN32 AND MINGW AND NOT IPP_VERSION_MAJOR LESS 7)
    # Since IPP built with Microsoft compiler and /GS option
    # ======================================================
    # From Windows SDK 7.1
    #   (usually in "C:\Program Files\Microsoft Visual Studio 10.0\VC\lib"),
    # to avoid undefined reference to __security_cookie and _chkstk:
    set(MSV_RUNTMCHK "RunTmChk")
    set(IPP_LIBRARIES ${IPP_LIBRARIES} ${MSV_RUNTMCHK}${IPP_LIB_SUFFIX})

    # To avoid undefined reference to _alldiv and _chkstk
    # ===================================================
    # NB: it may require a recompilation of w32api (after having modified
    #     the file ntdll.def) to export the required functions
    #     See http://code.opencv.org/issues/1906 for additional details
    set(MSV_NTDLL    "ntdll")
    set(IPP_LIBRARIES ${IPP_LIBRARIES} ${MSV_NTDLL}${IPP_LIB_SUFFIX})
endif()
I'm not a professional of CMake, but from what I understand it requires some resources of MSVC.... Am I correct ? Michele Adduci on 2014-11-04 13:59 WITH_IPP=OFF, I can compile OpenCV 3.0 with MSVC 2012 without any problem, using OpenNI2 support and OpenGL too. - % Done changed from 0 to 100 Maksim Shabunin on 2015-04-28 14:34 - Target version changed from 3.0 to 3.1 - Priority changed from Normal to Low

comments.comment: Still an issue on mingw 64bit on windows 8 with intel i7 4720HQ
I met the same issues with mingw, do we have a solution now? Do we have a target date of opencv3.1? thanks
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/chinadragon0515>@chinadragon0515</denchmark-link> You can try to use CMake parameter.
"Fixed" in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/pull/5282>#5282</denchmark-link> by disabling IPP by default for mingw builds. It can still be enabled b providing option to cmake.

That is not really a fix. You just disabled the IPP for mingw. When do you support this for mingw? Is that really a problem of mingw or are there just missing references to be solved without visual studio ? I like to use that for a performance critical application, so I'm really interested in a usable solution. thanks
